definition: poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly
country or countryside/native place/home village or town/township (PRC administrative unit)

sentences.english: That's why I'm going to live in the boonies.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么我要生活在穷乡僻壤。

sentences.english: See I grew up in a poor neighborhood in China.
sentences.chinese: 我是在中国的穷乡僻壤长大的。

sentences.english: Journey from dusk 'til dawn, the backcountry drawing you in deeper by the step.
sentences.chinese: 从黄昏到黎明的穷乡僻壤，绘图在更深的一步之旅。

sentences.english: Do you need topographic maps because you're wanting to get away into the backcountry?
sentences.chinese: 你需要的地形图，因为你想逃脱到穷乡僻壤？

sentences.english: Even small villages in the hinterlands of large cities were connected to some political center.
sentences.chinese: 即使是穷乡僻壤的小村落也与一些行政中心有联系。

sentences.english: With no clear objective or direction, Guri fled to the backwater of the galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 古丽漫无目的地逃往银河系的穷乡僻壤。

sentences.english: In the remote place, in the gloomy life which imprisons.
sentences.chinese: 在穷乡僻壤，在囚禁的阴暗生活中。

definition: lit. barren hills and wild rivers (idiom)/fig. inhospitable natural environment
lit. the sky is high and the emperor is far away (idiom)/fig. remote places are beyond the reach of the central government
